measure up.translation[0].definitions[0]: to be good enough to do a particular job or to reach a particular standard
We’ll give you a week’s trial in the job to see how you measure up.
How will the Secretary General measure up to his new responsibilities?
measure up.translation[0].definitions[1]: to measure something before you do something, for example before you put in new furniture, cupboards etc
I’d better measure up before I start laying the carpet.
Measure up any items that you want to keep in the kitchen.
measure up.translation[1].definitions[0]: to be good enough, or as good as expected
None of the products measured up.
Their performance in recent years hasn’t measured up to their longer-term record.
